summary: This document contains detailed forensic examination notes for two desktop computer images (Z6E8KD3N.E01 and JP15721E36LSNK.E01) from case 2019-010614. It describes the verification, processing, and analysis using forensic tools like EnCase, FTK, and AXIOM, including extensive artifact recovery and timeline analysis of user activity on August 9-10, 2019. This document is a forensic analysis report detailing computer system activity logs from a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) system, covering dates around August 9-10, 2019. It records user logins, lock/unlock events, application launches, and internet activity, and concludes a search for documents or communications related to inmates Jeffrey Epstein and Reyes found no relevant hits on the examined devices.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Subject of a forensic keyword search on the BOP computer systems; the analysis found no documents or communication hits for his name on the examined devices.

persons.name: LITS
persons.context: Listed as the examiner on the AXIOM case information for both computer images in this forensic analysis.

persons.name: User 8OP18923
persons.context: Identified user on the system Z6E8KD3N.E01 with detailed timeline of activity including logon, password reset, and application usage on August 9-10, 2019.

persons.name: Robert Adams
persons.context: Identified as the user (BOP55722) who successfully logged onto the system on August 10, 2019, at 14:04:11.

connections.description: The forensic examination is of computer images potentially associated with Jeffrey Epstein, and user 8OP18923 is an active user on one of those systems.
LITS is the forensic examiner analyzing computer images in a case (2019-010614) where Epstein's name is referenced.

events.title: Forensic Image Verification
events.description: Verification of two desktop computer images (Z6E8KD3N.E01 and JP15721E36LSNK.E01) using MD5 and SHA1 checksums.

events.title: AXIOM Processing of First Image
events.description: Forensic processing of image Z6E8KD3N.E01 in AXIOM software, resulting in extensive artifact recovery including internet history, documents, and pictures.

events.title: AXIOM Processing of Second Image
events.description: Forensic processing of image JP15721E36LSNK.E01 in AXIOM software, with similar extensive artifact recovery.

events.title: User Activity Timeline
events.description: Detailed timeline of user 8OP18923's activity on system Z6E8KD3N including logon, password reset, and use of GroupWise, Internet Explorer, and Microsoft Access.

events.title: BOP Computer System Activity
events.description: Extensive user activity recorded on a BOP computer system, including repeated system lock/unlock events by user BOP18923, launches of GroupWise email client and Internet Explorer, and numerous instances of internet activity recorded throughout the day and night.

events.title: Forensic Search for Epstein/Reyes Communications
events.description: Forensic analysis completed, reporting that a search for keywords related to inmates Jeffrey Edward Epstein and Reyes on two specific devices (Z6E8KD3N.E01 and JP1572JE36LSNK.E01) found no document or communication hits for Epstein and only a few bookmarked documents for Reyes.

keyFacts: The forensic examination recovered massive amounts of digital evidence including 953,022 pictures, 1,813 Word documents, 1,280 PDFs, extensive internet history, and social media artifacts from the computer images.
Specific search categories included 'Human Trafficking Site URLs' with 7 hits on one image and 1 hit on the other, indicating targeted forensic searching.
The timeline analysis shows precise user activity on August 9-10, 2019, including password reset and access to what appears to be an internal system ('https://10.33.56.106/TRUACCESS').
The forensic process was comprehensive, utilizing multiple tools (EnCase, FTK, AXIOM) and examining diverse artifact types from encrypted files to cryptocurrency-related data.
The forensic analysis found no documents or communications related to Jeffrey Epstein on the examined Bureau of Prisons computer devices.
User activity logs show intensive computer use by user BOP18923 on August 9, 2019, including email (GroupWise) and internet browsing late into the night.
The report notes that BOP email via GroupWise does not cache locally, meaning emails must be requested directly from BOP for analysis.
A period of no user computer activity was identified from August 8, 2019, at 08:26:59 to August 10, 2019, at 08:09:24 on one of the systems.
The analysis was specifically tasked with searching for keywords related to inmates 'Jeffrey Edward Epstein' and 'Reyes'.
